PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Gaps in a Resume ≠ Gaps in PotentialDon’t reject a candidate just because there’s a break in their resume timeline.Not every chapter of growth fits neatly into a job title.Behind every gap, there’s a story worth hearing:👶 Parenthood💔 Grieving a loss🌏 Exploring the world📚 Learning new skills🧘 Mental health recovery👩‍🔧 Shifting career pathsThese aren’t red flags.They’re real-life experiences that build resilience, empathy, and perspective.Let’s normalize asking:“What did you learn during that time?” instead of“Why weren’t you working?”Because value isn’t only built in office cubicles or Zoom calls.Talent is talent — with or without a perfectly filled resume.Let’s see the full human behind the application.hashtag#InclusiveHiring hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#MentalHealthAwarenesshashtag#Qatar hashtag#UK hashtag#USA hashtag#jobsinuae hashtag#jobs hashtag#job hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#jobsindubai hashtag#careers hashtag#jobseeker hashtag#recruitment hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Resume hashtag#Hiringnow hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#recruiting hashtag#Networking hashtag#Workfromhome hashtag#entrepreneur hashtag#Career hashtag#Jobinterviews hashtag#LinkedIn hashtag#Leadership hashtag#business hashtag#letsconnect hashtag#accountant hashtag#muhammadejazofficial hashtag#SocialNetworking

𝗕𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗞𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗔𝗟𝗘𝗥𝗧:   I just “unlocked” the ultimate Work From Home Job Offer —₹10 LPA | No Experience | No Interview.Sounds like a dream?Well… it's a 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹-𝗳𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲𝗱 𝗦𝗖𝗔𝗠.Here’s 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗶𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝗲𝘀:Step 1: You apply for a “𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲” opportunity seen on LinkedIn, Telegram, or WhatsApp.Step 2: Within 5 minutes, you receive this message:“𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 ₹𝟭 𝗟𝗮𝗸𝗵/𝗺𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗵?”Step 3: You reply “Yes.”Their reply:“𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀! 𝗬𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗕𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗲!”No resume. No interview. Not even your full name.What comes next?A “𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹” (𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱: 𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲) where your actual job is to:• Recruit more people• Sell hope, health kits, and “wealth programs”• Add strangers to WhatsApp groupsThey 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲:₹5-₹10 LPAEntrepreneurial growthFlexible WFH lifestyle𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:𝗡𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝘅𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗿𝘆𝗡𝗼 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗡𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻These fake offers 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗶𝘁:• 𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗝𝗼𝗯 𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗱𝘀• 𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗵𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀𝗥𝗲𝗱 𝗙𝗹𝗮𝗴𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗽𝗼𝘁:• “No qualifications required”• “Unlimited income”• “Refer 2 friends to start”• No official domain, no offer letter, no real HR process𝗔 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:If you're not being hired for your skills, you're being used for your contacts.𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲. 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗺𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝘁.Let’s fight this 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱 𝗰𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘀 ; one LinkedIn post at a time.hashtag#𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗺 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗔𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘁 hashtag#𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗧𝗶𝗽𝘀 hashtag#𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 hashtag#𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗦𝗮𝗳𝗲𝘁𝘆 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗛𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗕𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 hashtag#𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗻 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

🌿 Some Things Still Matter in This Industry…In this world of fast submissions, quick deals, and inboxes full of resumes… I’ve learned that some things still matter — even if no one talks about them.🤝 A thank-you message after a deal closes ⏳ A follow-up call even when there's no immediate need 🔁 A vendor who remembers your name… even after months 📩 A response that says, “Not this time — but keep sending”This industry can be transactional. But I still believe in relationships that last beyond one placement.To everyone out there — vendors, clients, recruiters, consultants — If you’re building something real, something consistent, Estimados miembros de la International Criminal Court Encuentro sorprendente y decepcionante que la reciente convocatoria para pasantías excluya a los ciudadanos venezolanos, especialmente considerando los hashtag#crímenesdelesahumanidad que enfrenta nuestro país. Esto genera preguntas sobre la imparcialidad de la International Criminal Court y su postura frente al gobierno de Maduro. ¿Podrían estar influyendo intereses económicos en decisiones que deberían ser estrictamente tomadas por la Corte? Es fundamental que se aclaren estos criterios para garantizar la transparencia y credibilidad de la institución.hashtag#JusticiaInternacionalhashtag#CPI hashtag#ICC hashtag#VenezuelaClamaJusticiahashtag#JusticiaParaVenezuelahashtag#DerechosHumanos hashtag#CrímenesDeLesaHumanidadhashtag#CrimenesDeLesaHumanidadEnVenezuelahashtag#PasantíasParaTodosxIgualhashtag#TransparenciaInternacional hashtag#ImparcialidaddeJuicio hashtag#MaduroGenocidahashtag#GlobalSouthVoicehashtag#JuicioParaNicolásMaduro

There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Gaps in a Resume ≠ Gaps in PotentialDon’t reject a candidate just because there’s a break in their resume timeline.Not every chapter of growth fits neatly into a job title.Behind every gap, there’s a story worth hearing:👶 Parenthood💔 Grieving a loss🌏 Exploring the world📚 Learning new skills🧘 Mental health recovery👩‍🔧 Shifting career pathsThese aren’t red flags.They’re real-life experiences that build resilience, empathy, and perspective.Let’s normalize asking:“What did you learn during that time?” instead of“Why weren’t you working?”Because value isn’t only built in office cubicles or Zoom calls.Talent is talent — with or without a perfectly filled resume.Let’s see the full human behind the application.hashtag#InclusiveHiring hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#MentalHealthAwarenesshashtag#Qatar hashtag#UK hashtag#USA hashtag#jobsinuae hashtag#jobs hashtag#job hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#jobsindubai hashtag#careers hashtag#jobseeker hashtag#recruitment hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Resume hashtag#Hiringnow hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#recruiting hashtag#Networking hashtag#Workfromhome hashtag#entrepreneur hashtag#Career hashtag#Jobinterviews hashtag#LinkedIn hashtag#Leadership hashtag#business hashtag#letsconnect hashtag#accountant hashtag#muhammadejazofficial hashtag#SocialNetworking

𝗕𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗞𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗔𝗟𝗘𝗥𝗧:   I just “unlocked” the ultimate Work From Home Job Offer —₹10 LPA | No Experience | No Interview.Sounds like a dream?Well… it's a 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹-𝗳𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲𝗱 𝗦𝗖𝗔𝗠.Here’s 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗶𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝗲𝘀:Step 1: You apply for a “𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲” opportunity seen on LinkedIn, Telegram, or WhatsApp.Step 2: Within 5 minutes, you receive this message:“𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 ₹𝟭 𝗟𝗮𝗸𝗵/𝗺𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗵?”Step 3: You reply “Yes.”Their reply:“𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀! 𝗬𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗕𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗲!”No resume. No interview. Not even your full name.What comes next?A “𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹” (𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱: 𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲) where your actual job is to:• Recruit more people• Sell hope, health kits, and “wealth programs”• Add strangers to WhatsApp groupsThey 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲:₹5-₹10 LPAEntrepreneurial growthFlexible WFH lifestyle𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:𝗡𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝘅𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗿𝘆𝗡𝗼 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗡𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻These fake offers 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗶𝘁:• 𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗝𝗼𝗯 𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗱𝘀• 𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗵𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀𝗥𝗲𝗱 𝗙𝗹𝗮𝗴𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗽𝗼𝘁:• “No qualifications required”• “Unlimited income”• “Refer 2 friends to start”• No official domain, no offer letter, no real HR process𝗔 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:If you're not being hired for your skills, you're being used for your contacts.𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲. 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗺𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝘁.Let’s fight this 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱 𝗰𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘀 ; one LinkedIn post at a time.hashtag#𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗺 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗔𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘁 hashtag#𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗧𝗶𝗽𝘀 hashtag#𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 hashtag#𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗦𝗮𝗳𝗲𝘁𝘆 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗛𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗕𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 hashtag#𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗻 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

🌿 Some Things Still Matter in This Industry…In this world of fast submissions, quick deals, and inboxes full of resumes… I’ve learned that some things still matter — even if no one talks about them.🤝 A thank-you message after a deal closes ⏳ A follow-up call even when there's no immediate need 🔁 A vendor who remembers your name… even after months 📩 A response that says, “Not this time — but keep sending”This industry can be transactional. But I still believe in relationships that last beyond one placement.To everyone out there — vendors, clients, recruiters, consultants — If you’re building something real, something consistent, Estimados miembros de la International Criminal Court Encuentro sorprendente y decepcionante que la reciente convocatoria para pasantías excluya a los ciudadanos venezolanos, especialmente considerando los hashtag#crímenesdelesahumanidad que enfrenta nuestro país. Esto genera preguntas sobre la imparcialidad de la International Criminal Court y su postura frente al gobierno de Maduro. ¿Podrían estar influyendo intereses económicos en decisiones que deberían ser estrictamente tomadas por la Corte? There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Gaps in a Resume ≠ Gaps in PotentialDon’t reject a candidate just because there’s a break in their resume timeline.Not every chapter of growth fits neatly into a job title.Behind every gap, there’s a story worth hearing:👶 Parenthood💔 Grieving a loss🌏 Exploring the world📚 Learning new skills🧘 Mental health recovery👩‍🔧 Shifting career pathsThese aren’t red flags.They’re real-life experiences that build resilience, empathy, and perspective.Let’s normalize asking:“What did you learn during that time?” instead of“Why weren’t you working?”Because value isn’t only built in office cubicles or Zoom calls.Talent is talent — with or without a perfectly filled resume.Let’s see the full human behind the application.hashtag#InclusiveHiring hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#MentalHealthAwarenesshashtag#Qatar hashtag#UK hashtag#USA hashtag#jobsinuae hashtag#jobs hashtag#job hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#jobsindubai hashtag#careers hashtag#jobseeker hashtag#recruitment hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Resume hashtag#Hiringnow hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#recruiting hashtag#Networking hashtag#Workfromhome hashtag#entrepreneur hashtag#Career hashtag#Jobinterviews hashtag#LinkedIn hashtag#Leadership hashtag#business hashtag#letsconnect hashtag#accountant hashtag#muhammadejazofficial hashtag#SocialNetworking

𝗕𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗞𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗔𝗟𝗘𝗥𝗧:   I just “unlocked” the ultimate Work From Home Job Offer —₹10 LPA | No Experience | No Interview.Sounds like a dream?Well… it's a 𝗳𝘂𝗹𝗹-𝗳𝗹𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲𝗱 𝗦𝗖𝗔𝗠.Here’s 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗶𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝗲𝘀:Step 1: You apply for a “𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲” opportunity seen on LinkedIn, Telegram, or WhatsApp.Step 2: Within 5 minutes, you receive this message:“𝗔𝗿𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 ₹𝟭 𝗟𝗮𝗸𝗵/𝗺𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗵?”Step 3: You reply “Yes.”Their reply:“𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀! 𝗬𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗕𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗲!”No resume. No interview. Not even your full name.What comes next?A “𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹” (𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱: 𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲) where your actual job is to:• Recruit more people• Sell hope, health kits, and “wealth programs”• Add strangers to WhatsApp groupsThey 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲:₹5-₹10 LPAEntrepreneurial growthFlexible WFH lifestyle𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:𝗡𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝘅𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗿𝘆𝗡𝗼 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗡𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻These fake offers 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗶𝘁:• 𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗝𝗼𝗯 𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗱𝘀• 𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗵𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀𝗥𝗲𝗱 𝗙𝗹𝗮𝗴𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗽𝗼𝘁:• “No qualifications required”• “Unlimited income”• “Refer 2 friends to start”• No official domain, no offer letter, no real HR process𝗔 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:If you're not being hired for your skills, you're being used for your contacts.𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲. 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗺𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝘁.Let’s fight this 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱 𝗰𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘀 ; one LinkedIn post at a time.hashtag#𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗺 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗔𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘁 hashtag#𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗧𝗶𝗽𝘀 hashtag#𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 hashtag#𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗦𝗮𝗳𝗲𝘁𝘆 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗛𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗕𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 hashtag#𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗻 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

🌿 Some Things Still Matter in This Industry…In this world of fast submissions, quick deals, and inboxes full of resumes… I’ve learned that some things still matter — even if no one talks about them.🤝 A thank-you message after a deal closes ⏳ A follow-up call even when there's no immediate need 🔁 A vendor who remembers your name… even after months 📩 A response that says, “Not this time — but keep sending”This industry can be transactional. But I still believe in relationships that last beyond one placement.To everyone out there — vendors, clients, recruiters, consultants — If you’re building something real, something consistent, Estimados miembros de la International Criminal Court Encuentro sorprendente y decepcionante que la reciente convocatoria para pasantías excluya a los ciudadanos venezolanos, especialmente considerando los hashtag#crímenesdelesahumanidad que enfrenta nuestro país. Esto genera preguntas sobre la imparcialidad de la International Criminal Court y su postura frente al gobierno de Maduro. ¿Podrían estar influyendo intereses económicos en decisiones que deberían ser estrictamente tomadas por la Corte? There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

"How to Build Long-Term Client Relationships" Anyone can close a deal. But can you build a repeat client? Here’s what I focus on every day: 1️⃣ Be Available — Especially when things go wrong. 2️⃣ Be Honest — No fake promises. No ghosting. 3️⃣ Be Curious — Ask what they need, not what you want to sell. 4️⃣ Be Consistent — It's not a one-time effort. It's long-term follow-through.A true client relationship is when they say: "We’ll wait till you get back to us." Not: “We’re going with someone else.”Are you building trust or just transactions? 🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

"How to Build Long-Term Client Relationships" Anyone can close a deal. But can you build a repeat client? Here’s what I focus on every day: 1️⃣ Be Available — Especially when things go wrong. 2️⃣ Be Honest — No fake promises. No ghosting. 3️⃣ Be Curious — Ask what they need, not what you want to sell. 4️⃣ Be Consistent — It's not a one-time effort. It's long-term follow-through.A true client relationship is when they say: "We’ll wait till you get back to us." Not: “We’re going with someone else.”Are you building trust or just transactions? 🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

🌿 Some Things Still Matter in This Industry…In this world of fast submissions, quick deals, and inboxes full of resumes… I’ve learned that some things still matter — even if no one talks about them.🤝 A thank-you message after a deal closes ⏳ A follow-up call even when there's no immediate need 🔁 A vendor who remembers your name… even after months 📩 A response that says, “Not this time — but keep sending”This industry can be transactional. But I still believe in relationships that last beyond one placement.To everyone out there — vendors, clients, recruiters, consultants — If you’re building something real, something consistent, Esto genera preguntas sobre la imparcialidad de la International Criminal Court y su postura frente al gobierno de Maduro. ¿Podrían estar influyendo intereses económicos en decisiones que deberían ser estrictamente tomadas por la Corte? There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

"How to Build Long-Term Client Relationships" Anyone can close a deal. But can you build a repeat client? Here’s what I focus on every day: 1️⃣ Be Available — Especially when things go wrong. 2️⃣ Be Honest — No fake promises. No ghosting. 3️⃣ Be Curious — Ask what they need, not what you want to sell. 4️⃣ Be Consistent — It's not a one-time effort. It's long-term follow-through.A true client relationship is when they say: "We’ll wait till you get back to us." Not: “We’re going with someone else.”Are you building trust or just transactions? 🔍 LINQ Tip: OrderBy() vs ThenBy() – Sort Smarter, Not Harder!Need to sort your data on multiple fields? LINQ has you covered with OrderBy() and ThenBy() — but using them correctly makes all the difference.✅ OrderBy() Sorts a sequence in ascending order based on the first key. This is your primary sort.✅ ThenBy() Applies a secondary sort (or more) after the initial OrderBy().📌 Want descending order? Use OrderByDescending() and ThenByDescending() similarly.🎯 Mastering OrderBy/ThenBy makes your data presentation clean, predictable, and professional.hashtag#dotnet hashtag#csharp hashtag#LINQ hashtag#backenddevelopment hashtag#cleanarchitecture hashtag#programmingtips hashtag#developerslife

Experience is valuable—but it’s not everything. hashtag#fresher hashtag#experience Every industry veteran once stood at the starting line—no titles, no years of experience, just raw passion and potential.Yet today, many freshers face closed doors simply because they don’t have "x years" on a résumé.But here’s a reality check 👇 📌 Experience is earned— not something you're born with. 📌 Potential can’t always be measured in years.🚀 Why Freshers Are Secret Weapons for Growth:🔹 Original Thinking – They aren’t limited by “how things have always been done.” That means fresh ideas, new angles, and innovative solutions.🔹 Quick Adaptability – Tech evolves. Markets change. Freshers are wired to learn fast and pivot faster.🔹 Unmatched Energy – They're driven, curious, and ready to prove themselves. That hustle? It’s gold.🔹 Coachability > Conditioning – With no rigid habits or egos, freshers can be mentored into high-performers and future leaders.The Real Issue?We confuse experience with capability. We reject talent before it even gets a chance to grow.If every company waits for candidates with experience… Who will create the next generation of experienced professionals?✅ Smart companies don’t just hire résumés—they hire potential. They ask: 🔍 “Can this person grow into greatness?” Not just: ❌ “Do they check every box today?”💡 Freshers don’t come with baggage—they come with boldness. Nurture them, invest in them, and they’ll build your future.👉 Have you witnessed a fresher outshine a seasoned pro? Let’s hear your story! Drop it in the comments below. 👇Let’s change the narrative. Let’s give potential a chance. 💼💥Follow me for more thoughts on hiring, leadership, and building future-ready teams.

PRE-QUALIFICATION METHODOLOGY – VETASSESS Skills Assessment!Pre-qualification experience refers to work experience gained prior to completing your formal qualification (such as a diploma or bachelor’s degree). VETASSESS may consider this experience for a skills assessment, but only if specific additional requirements are met.For occupations classified under Groups B, C, and D, applicants must demonstrate:• A period of highly relevant pre-qualification employment at the required skill level, and• At least one year of highly relevant employment performed within the last five years before applying.The additional pre-qualification experience required is as follows:• Group B: At least five extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.• Groups C and D: At least three extra years of relevant employment prior to the qualification.This methodology allows applicants who have been working in the field before completing their studies to still be eligible for a positive skills assessment — provided they clearly demonstrate the employment was at the required skill level.For Example: Civil Engineering Draftsperson (Group C Occupation)• Qualification: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering• Work Experience: Involved in civil engineering drafting projects even before completing the bachelor's degreeDespite holding a degree in a different discipline, the candidate has:• 3 years of highly relevant pre-qualification work experience, and• 1 year of relevant employment within the last 5 yearsThis makes them eligible for a positive skills assessment as a Civil Engineering Draftsperson under Group C through VETASSESS, using the pre-qualification employment pathway.Kind regards!Zara Wangchuk Senior Skills Assessment expert +61 481 607 652/ +61 483 931 112zara@cdrwritersaustralia.comFacebook- https://lnkd.in/gNBGSxBJLinkedIn-https: https://lnkd.in/gMahbYE6WhatsApp Group- https://lnkd.in/gedzveHJ

Gaps in a Resume ≠ Gaps in PotentialDon’t reject a candidate just because there’s a break in their resume timeline.Not every chapter of growth fits neatly into a job title.Behind every gap, there’s a story worth hearing:👶 Parenthood💔 Grieving a loss🌏 Exploring the world📚 Learning new skills🧘 Mental health recovery👩‍🔧 Shifting career pathsThese aren’t red flags.They’re real-life experiences that build resilience, empathy, and perspective.Let’s normalize asking:“What did you learn during that time?” instead of“Why weren’t you working?”Because value isn’t only built in office cubicles or Zoom calls.Talent is talent — with or without a perfectly filled resume.Let’s see the full human behind the application.hashtag#InclusiveHiring hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#HRLeadership hashtag#MentalHealthAwarenesshashtag#Qatar hashtag#UK hashtag#USA hashtag#jobsinuae hashtag#jobs hashtag#job hashtag#jobsearch hashtag#jobsindubai hashtag#careers hashtag#jobseeker hashtag#recruitment hashtag#Dubai hashtag#Resume hashtag#Hiringnow hashtag#interview hashtag#hiring hashtag#recruiting hashtag#Networking hashtag#Workfromhome hashtag#entrepreneur hashtag#Career hashtag#Jobinterviews hashtag#LinkedIn hashtag#Leadership hashtag#business hashtag#letsconnect hashtag#accountant hashtag#muhammadejazofficial hashtag#SocialNetworking

𝗬𝗼𝘂’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝗕𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗲!”No resume. No interview. Not even your full name.What comes next?A “𝗡𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹” (𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱: 𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲) where your actual job is to:• Recruit more people• Sell hope, health kits, and “wealth programs”• Add strangers to WhatsApp groupsThey 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲:₹5-₹10 LPAEntrepreneurial growthFlexible WFH lifestyle𝗧𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:𝗡𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝘅𝗲𝗱 𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗮𝗿𝘆𝗡𝗼 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗲𝗡𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻These fake offers 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗶𝘁:• 𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗝𝗼𝗯 𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗲𝗿𝘀• 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗱𝘀• 𝗔𝗻𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗵𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀𝗥𝗲𝗱 𝗙𝗹𝗮𝗴𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗽𝗼𝘁:• “No qualifications required”• “Unlimited income”• “Refer 2 friends to start”• No official domain, no offer letter, no real HR process𝗔 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝘁𝗵:If you're not being hired for your skills, you're being used for your contacts.𝗦𝘁𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲. 𝗦𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗺𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝘁.Let’s fight this 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱 𝗰𝗿𝗶𝘀𝗶𝘀 ; one LinkedIn post at a time.hashtag#𝗪𝗼𝗿𝗸𝗙𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗛𝗼𝗺𝗲𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗺 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗔𝗹𝗲𝗿𝘁 hashtag#𝗣𝘆𝗿𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗱𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗺𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗧𝗶𝗽𝘀 hashtag#𝗥𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀 hashtag#𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗦𝗮𝗳𝗲𝘁𝘆 hashtag#𝗝𝗼𝗯𝗛𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗕𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲 hashtag#𝗟𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗲𝗱𝗜𝗻𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 hashtag#𝗔𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗻 hashtag#𝗙𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗣𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

🌿 Some Things Still Matter in This Industry…In this world of fast submissions, quick deals, and inboxes full of resumes… I’ve learned that some things still matter — even if no one talks about them.🤝 A thank-you message after a deal closes ⏳ A follow-up call even when there's no immediate need 🔁 A vendor who remembers your name… even after months 📩 A response that says, “Not this time — but keep sending”This industry can be transactional. But I still believe in relationships that last beyond one placement.To everyone out there — vendors, clients, recruiters, consultants — If you’re building something real, something consistent, Estimados miembros de la International Criminal Court Encuentro sorprendente y decepcionante que la reciente convocatoria para pasantías excluya a los ciudadanos venezolanos, especialmente considerando los hashtag#crímenesdelesahumanidad que enfrenta nuestro país. Esto genera preguntas sobre la imparcialidad de la International Criminal Court y su postura frente al gobierno de Maduro. ¿Podrían estar influyendo intereses económicos en decisiones que deberían ser estrictamente tomadas por la Corte? There’s this thing – that hasn’t made me admire Kwanda any less. If anything, it’s made me realize just how much I want to be part of what they’re building. Kwanda represents something rare a platform that actually trusts communities to know what they need. While others throw money at problems without sustainable drivers, Kwanda listens first. They understand that real change isn’t about grand gestures, but about empowering people to build their own solutions with full sustainability framework.What gets me is how they have created this bridge between diasporans who want to help and communities ready to do the work. It’s not charity. It’s partnership.I have watched them back projects that others would overlook the kind that don’t make flashy headlines but actually change lives. There’s a humility to their approach that’s stuck with me. They don’t pretend to have all the answers. They just create space for the right ones to emerge. Maybe this is the right time? All I know is this when our paths finally cross, I'm ready. Not just with skills, but with the same stubborn belief that change works best when it starts from the ground up. Kwanda’s support and shown us how it’s done. Now I’d like to help them do even more.Mr. Jermaine Craig I'm fully ready to join your team!

"How to Build Long-Term Client Relationships" Anyone can close a deal. But can you build a repeat client? Here’s what I focus on every day: 1️⃣ Be Available — Especially when things go wrong. 2️⃣ Be Honest — No fake promises. No ghosting. 3️⃣ Be Curious — Ask what they need, not what you want to sell. 4️⃣ Be Consistent — It's not a one-time effort. It's long-term follow-through.A true client relationship is when they say: "We’ll wait till you get back to us." Not: “We’re going with someone else.”Are you building trust or just transactions? 🔍 Equality in C#: == vs Equals()Hey folks!I’ve run into subtle bugs in my code more than once, only to discover the root cause was how I was comparing objects. In C#, == and Equals() seem to do the same thing—until they surprise you with unexpected behavior.Here’s my personal cheat sheet on the key differences—no fluff, just clarity to help you write cleaner, less error-prone code.🔹 The == OperatorCompile-time binding → Decided by the compilerReference types → Checks if both variables point to the same objectValue types → Compares the actual values; for custom structs, you’ll need to overload itNull-safe → null == null is true, null == non-null is false🔹 The Equals() MethodRuntime binding → Supports overrides and polymorphismReference types → Default compares references, but can be overridden for content comparisonValue types → Uses reflection to compare fields (not very performant—consider overriding)Null handling → a.Equals(b) throws if a is null → prefer object.Equals(a, b) for safety📖 A Real-Life AnalogyImagine two copies of The Great Gatsby:==: “Are these the exact same physical book?”Equals(): “Do these books contain the same text?”📝 Quick Code Sampleclass Book { public string Title; public override bool Equals(object obj) => obj is Book b && Title == b.Title; public static bool operator ==(Book a, Book b) => object.Equals(a, b); public static bool operator !=(Book a, Book b) => !object.Equals(a, b); public override int GetHashCode() => Title?.GetHashCode() ?? 0;}🚦 When to Use Which?Pro tip: If you override Equals(), always override GetHashCode() too. It’s essential for correct behavior in dictionaries and hash-based collections.👇 What’s the trickiest equality bug you’ve solved in C#? Share your story—let’s learn from each other!hashtag#CSharp hashtag#DotNet hashtag#CleanCode hashtag#DeveloperTips hashtag#CodingBestPractices hashtag#DotNetDevelopers
